_description: Lydgate’s ‘Banner of St Edmund’ — ten 8-line stanzas

BodAsh46.First Lines:
Blyssed Edmond martir and virgineHad in thre vertues by grace a
                    souereyn prysBy which he venquysshed al venymes serpentineAdam be
                    aserpent banysshed ffro paradys…
BodAsh46.Last Lines:
…The Thrydde Crowne to Receyve in certeyneffor his merytes
                    aboue the sterrys sevene

BodTan347.First Lines:
[B]lyssed Edmond martir and virgineHad in thre vertues bygrace a
                    souereyn prys…
BodTan347.Last Lines:
…The thrydde Trowne to receyve in certeyneffor his merytes
                    abowe the sterrys sevene

OxfCCC61.First Lines:
A Blissid Edmond king martir & virgineHad in þre virtues
                    by grace a souerain…
OxfCCC61.Last Lines:
…In þis lyfe here aftirward in heuyneffor his meritis
                    above þe sterres seuyne
OxfCCC61.Attributed Title:
Sequitur descripcio primi vexilli Regis predictis armorum suorum, et
                        cetera (f. 64v); Explicit applicacio (f. 65v)

CULEe215.First Lines:
Blyssid Edmund kynge martyr and virgynhad in thre vertuous by grace
                    of sovereyn pryse…
CULEe215.Last Lines:
…The thyrd crowne to resseyue in certeyneffor hys meryte a
                    bove the sterrys seuyn
CULEe215.Note:
Follows 1535 as if part
                    of same work

BLHar372.First Lines:
Blissid Edmund kyng martir & virgynehad in thre vertues bi
                    grace a souereyne pryce…
BLHar372.Last Lines:
…the thridde crown to receyve in certeyneffor his merites
                    aboue þe sterres seuene

BLHar2278.First Lines: BLyssyd Edmund kyng martir and vyrgyneHadde in thre vertues by grace a souereyn prys…
BLHar2278.Last Lines: …Which for our feith suffrede PassiounBlyssyd Edmund kyng martir and virgyne

BLHar2278.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl. 
             Altenglische Legenden: Neue Folge.
         Heilbronn: Henninger, 1881: 376-8.
Hervey,  Lord Francis. 
             Corolla Sancti Edmundi.
         London: J. Murray, 1907: 405-8.
